title: For people saying "carry your way out of bronze"...
body:
This is what happens in 90% of my bronze games.** I AM DARIUS. NOT EKKO!
**
Nidalee was last pick, didn't talk until they were locking in (this happens regardless of the new champ pick, or the old) & proceeded to say "I don't like Darius as top, so I'm going to feed guys, sorry". 

He went into the game, bought only the items you can see, fed 2 lanes silently, said "lol", quit. So it was 4v5 with a Quinn & Zed given first/second/third/fourth blood's which is all that's needed to A: tilt the lanes in their favour due to people feeling negative and B: allow the other team the confidence to know there's infighting and trolling on our team.

Game over.

You can say "OMG YOU CAN TOTALLY TURN IT AROUND, I KNOW I WOULD!!" or "not all of your games can be like this, this is a bad example, I have xxx in my games!" etc. I don't care. This is ALL I see. It's either an afk, feeding, toxicity, etc etc. 

I can deal with bad players, I can deal with people that get countered due to bad picks, whatever. I can't deal with these scenarios. It's pathetic, and it's so common it pains me to even bother playing any more.

I couldn't care less what my rank is, I just like playing the game & actually earning/losing something at the end based upon my skill level. Normals don't offer that because people generally take it even less seriously than bronze level ranked, & I don't gain or lose anything based upon playing so I'm just kind of like "meh, who cares?". 

Obviously the care factor in rank also becomes meaningless over time due to the fact that I have zero influence on what happens in the game. I can't alter the outcome of a game where someone decides they're going to deliberately lose it from the start. 

I've played multiple MMO/team games that require people to work together, & I've never in my life seen a game so FILLED with people that just want to destroy the fun that others have so that they can laugh, or whatever.

There should be a WoW-esque scenario where you have to do proving grounds (google it if you've no idea what I'm talking about) to prove you have a basic understanding of game mechanics, and have to do a certain amount of cs/damage/healing whatever before you're capable of entering the ranked scene. 

If it isn't taken seriously, then what's the point? Where's the learning?

I literally can't remember the last game I've played where someone doesn't go 0/20/0 or never connect, or connect & flame the team, or multiple other scenarios.

I know I'm terrible, I don't need people going through my game history pointing out that I'm terrible. All I want is for people to know that it's impossible to improve at this level of the game when you're instantly behind before the match even starts because one team is guaranteed a feeder/toxic/afk/man-child whatever to sway it in one direction.

So any win you have is meaningless, because it's one of the above, and any loss you have is out of your control due to the fact that you've generally got one of the above.

It makes me blind. I hate this game.

Honestly, as a person who has had many friends in Elo Hell/Elo hell veterans I have to give you this advice.

1. Before playing ranked, pick 2 lanes you are good (better at then the rest) 

2. Then pick 2/3 champions for those two lanes that are easy for you or are notorious low Elo solo stompers (Riven, Malphite, etc.) I personally wouldn't recommend Darius because you can't carry as him and if you are behind, you become as useful as a Caster minion.

3. After you pick those champs play those champs in normals/drafts ALL THE TIME, getting them to mastery lv 4/5 might be a nice goal. Also go on lol wiki and know everything about that champ.

4. Try to get a duo parter and make a Skype/curse/etc. call. 1 person you can trust and that you are in verbal contact with is worth it's weight in gold (no pun intended :))

5. Watch pro/challenger players and see how they play your champs and what they do in certain situations.

I know it's a bit long, but that's how I did it and I'm pretty well off (I got to silver 1 after promos)

Edit: also try to have fun with it, you will get games with trolls, feeders, regardless what Elo you are in. 
Also having a good mouse/track pad also will give you an edge.

Here:

If you play at silver level, you have to play a lot of games to climb. At this level, you are winning about 55-67% of your games. This takes into account your trolls and feeders (remember that both teams have it, but the chances of one being your team, 4/10 is less than the enemy's chances, 5/10).

If you play at a gold+ level, bronze games should be way too easy for you. You should be getting fed and one-man carrying most of your games regardless if there is a feeder/troll on your team (with the exception for cases where the enemy is constantly running into the enemy team no purpose, but these scenarios are uncommon and should not deter you from climbing). I am plat this in season 5 and gold in seasons before it. From my perspective (when I was gold), bronze players were painfully bad. Like - it's not even... oh they're a little bit worse than me. It was more like... holy crap these people either have $100 computers or they're just downright mentally challenged. Bronze players are bad beyond imagination; and therefore if truly deserve to be gold+, you should be able to carry with blindfolds on (exaggeration).

If you are winning ~50% or less of your games, you are bronze - PERIOD.

How to determine your level: Play AI games at the hardest difficulty 

Required: Pick a champion you have never played or is not very proficient with - do not pick your "main".
If you're losing your lane, you are bronze.
In a situation where your teammates are losing lane, if you cannot carry them against AI - you are bronze.
If your games against AI's are closely contested, you are bronze.
If your farm at 20 minutes is below 100, you are bronze.
If your farm at 20 minutes is below 130, you are low to mid silver - basically bronze.
If you are clearly winning, but require to put in effort, you are low to mid silver - which is basically bronze.
If you are clearly winning, but only because you need to cheese to get ahead, you are low to mid silver - which is basically bronze.
If you are clearly winning with little effort, you are silver.
If you are getting fed like crazy (consistently), you MIGHT be high silver/low gold.

In insure getting out of bronze, your score in an AI game should consistently, with your worse champion, be something like... 15+/0-2/5+ with 150+ farm @ 20 minutes. The farm number is considered low, but I'm taking into account you running around and KSing your teammates.

If you are in fact getting afk/feeders every game and you are never one of them then statistically they should be on the enemy team more frequently than yours eventually allowing you to won more and climb out of that shitty elo. 

Despite that if you want to avoid those kind of games I'd suggest experimenting with the time of the day you play ranked. I've noticed that when you play ranked changes the experience to a large degree. Night seemed general bad, middle of day seems highly competitive and afternoon seems to be less competitive but not rage filled, at least in my experience
